definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Learn the rules so you know how to break them properly.
sentences.chinese: 先弄懂規則，纔會知道該如何適切地打破成規。

sentences.english: Why do we have to stick to conventions and dare not go one step beyond the prescribed limit?
sentences.chinese: 我們爲什麼要墨守成規，不敢越雷池一步呢？

sentences.english: He showed little initiative, handling all matters strictly by the book.
sentences.chinese: 他缺乏首創精神，墨守成規地辦一切事情。

sentences.english: You will never change their ideas. They are far too hidebound .
sentences.chinese: 你無法改變他們的意思，因爲他們太墨守成規。

sentences.english: Unlucky people tend to be creatures of routine.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的人往往是默守成規的產物。

sentences.english: These breakthrough the traditional story ruts which thinking much of polt and narrating single angle.
sentences.chinese: 這些突破了傳統小說重情節，敘述角度單一的成規。

sentences.english: Ted is a real stick- in- the- mud.
sentences.chinese: 特德真是個墨守成規的人。

definition: to cleanse oneself/to sanctify oneself/self-cleaning (spark plug, oven etc)
sahasrāra or sahasrara, the crown or fontanel chakra 查克拉, residing at the top of the skull
sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
lit. to attend to one thing and lose sight of another (idiom)/fig. to be unable to manage two or more things at once/cannot pay attention to one thing without neglecting the other
to review the old and know the new (idiom, from the Analects)/to recall the past to understand the future
lit. four ounces can move a thousand catties (idiom)/fig. to achieve much with little effort
a kind of traditional Chinese sword-play
lit. to breathe out stale air and breathe in fresh (idiom, from Zhuangzi 庄子); fig. to get rid of the old and bring in the new
